article_headline: English: a minor for all mayors
article_text: to finish their food outside or to throw it away, he said. "Fortunately Iâ€™ve never encountered a student who did not cooperate when confronted with the problem," Walch said. "If there was an attitude of belligerence, we would call security. The size of the library makes food control difficult, Walch added. With five stories and 2,300 student study spots, a full-time employee would be needed to police the library, he said. Walch said the library staff tries to catch people with food as they enter the library, but with an average of 5,000 students entering each day, stopping the majority of violators is doubtful. Walch said he would welcome a student volunteer group to help supervise but has not planned such a group as of yet.
